headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Campbell's’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Campbell's third quarter results saw revenue come in above Wall Street expectations, but the company faced a year-over-year sales decline as shifting consumer habits and cost pressures weighed on performance. Management pointed to ongoing softness in snack volumes and selective price increases as key drivers, with CEO Mick Beekhuyzen noting that "cost increases and top line headwinds" were not fully offset by recent productivity and pricing actions.
